alert.note: Alert for Cuyama Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 12 at 3:30AM PDT until March 15 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County and the Ventura County portion of the Santa Ynez Mountains. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain and excessive runoff may result in dangerous flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Rivers and creeks that may be affected include, but are not limited to, the Sisquoc River, the Santa Ynez River, and San Antonio Creek. Extensive street flooding is likely. There may be mudslides and rockslides, especially in and near steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A powerful winter storm is expected to bring heavy rain to the watch area. Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches are expected in many areas, with local totals up to 6 inches in the foothills and mountains. Rainfall rates of one half inch to one inch per hour are possible during the peak of the storm. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
